alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 5:09PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN...WEST CENTRAL DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Ramon, or 21 miles southeast of Vaughn, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Vaughn and Ramon. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 173 and 204. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 272 and 299. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County
